intro: Gymnaster koraiensis, commonly known as the Korean gymnaster, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Korea. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species. Its botanical features make it an important subject for ecological and conservation studies.
